plugins.name: SelectLock
plugins.description:
üí™üèΩ Take control of your Figma layers with SelectLock!


SelectLock is your secret weapon for maintaining design integrity in Figma. This powerful plugin lets you lock multiple layers in one go while keeping specific layer types editable.


Here's what you can do:


  1. Bulk lock layers across your entire Figma file
  2. Cherry-pick which layer types stay unlocked
  3. Use a simple checkbox interface for layer selection
  4. Lock your design with just one click
  5. Keep your layer structure intact


Perfect for designers who want to secure their work without sacrificing flexibility. Whether you're polishing a final design or collaborating with a team, SelectLock helps you stay in control. Say goodbye to the tedious task of locking layers one by one. With SelectLock, you're the boss of your design file!


üëâüèº Click here to drop a feedback

üëâüèº Send me a mail


Thank you for using SelectLock.


üëâüèº How to Use


  1. Select the frame or group containing the layers you want to lock
  2. Run the Selectlock plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. In the plugin interface, check the boxes next to any layer types you want to lock/unlock
  4. Click the "Lock/Unlock" button
  5. All checked layer types will be locked/unlocked, while unchecked layer types remain editable/uneditable.
plugins.tagline: Lock specific layer types in bulk. Keep designing freely.

plugins.name: Sections
plugins.description:
Organize the sections in your file in a few clicks.


How it works:


  1. Launch: CMD+K and type "Sections".
  2. Choose direction: vertical or horizontal.
  3. Set spacing: 100, 250, or 500px presets. (Custom coming soon!)
  4. Apply: Watch Sections organize the sections in your file.


Be default Sections will apply changes to all the sections on the page. If 2 or more sections are selected, then changes will only apply to those.


üçªCheers to cleaner Figma files.
plugins.tagline: Auto layout your sections.

plugins.description:
This tool allows you to create beautiful mesh gradients with customizable color points. You can:

  1. Add and remove color points
  2. Adjust colors using the color picker
  3. Change the aspect ratio
  4. Save your gradients as PNG files

The gradients are generated using WebGL and RBF interpolation for smooth performance and high-quality output.


Website version: https://pkolesnikov.com/meshgradients

plugins.name: Consistent contacts
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to create your own data structure (text or image) and than fill the data into your frames based on matching layer and key name. You have to have the data structure in a predefined JSON format. Example:

{

"records": [

{

"photo": { "image": "avatar-01.jpg" },

"name": "John Doe",

"id": "1234",

"phone": "+1 110-1234",

"company": "TechNova Inc.",

"position": "Software Engineer",

"email": "john.doe@technova.com"

}

]

}

The JSON can be ZIPped with images to a single file, which you can drop to the plugin and populate the frames. The populated frames have to be wrapped together in a parent frame or a component instance works as well. All the frames or instances have to be selected directly to be populated correctly.


WEBP image format is not supported by Figma. JPG and PNG formats works. The whole ZIP file has to be smaller than 1MB, which is a memory limit for any plugin. The ZIP file is remembered, even if you close the plugin, but it is removed from memory and replaced by a new one, if you select a new file.


Not being a developer myself, this is my very first attempt to create a Figma plugin with a huge help from AI. I was able to make it into a working prototype, but there might still be some glitches. If the plugin does not work correctly, check the ZIP content, JSON structure and correct naming of the images. If the plugin stops to work, try to "Clear memory" via a dedicated button. It should reset everything and clean the memory of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Fill in consistent connected data to your frames

Line Height Fixer is an automatic line-height adjustment plugin. It aligns the line height of text layers with the actual height of the font, solving inconsistencies between design drafts and the text heights in development environments. This helps developers accurately restore design drafts and simplifies the review process.


‚ú® Plugin Features:


  1. Select a text layer and click "Fix in One Click" to automatically adjust the line height.
  2. Select a layer containing text, and with just one click, all text elements within the layer will have their line heights adjusted.
  3. Free! Yes, it's completely free!


üé® Upcoming Features:


  1. Currently, the plugin only supports automatic line-height adjustments for single-line text. Multi-line text handling is not yet implemented.
  2. (I haven‚Äôt decided what‚Äôs next‚Äîif you have better ideas, feel free to email me!)

plugins.name: Polaroids
plugins.description:
Polaroids ‚Äì Bring a Touch of Nostalgia to Your Designs

Transform any frame into a beautifully styled Polaroid image‚Äîin seconds.


Polaroid Maker is your go-to tool for adding a warm, analog vibe to digital designs. Whether you‚Äôre building a moodboard, designing a presentation, or crafting a portfolio, this plugin helps you wrap your visuals in the charm of vintage photography.


Features:

Adjustable Padding ‚Äì Control the spacing for that perfect Polaroid balance.


Customizable Corner Radius ‚Äì Keep it sharp or go rounded for a softer feel.


Handwritten-style Captions ‚Äì Add personality with a built-in handwriting font.


Stacking Options ‚Äì Single, double, or multiple cards for layered vibes.


Shadow Effects ‚Äì Add subtle or dramatic depth with three shadow styles.


Polaroid Maker was built to make visual storytelling more tactile, expressive, and fun‚Äîwithout needing any design hacks or frame juggling.
plugins.tagline: Turn any frame into a clean, customizable Polaroid.

plugins.name: wip!
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to add or remove a red semi-transparent overlay to selected frames in Figma. It is designed to visually mark work-in-progress (WIP) elements directly within the design interface.


How to use

  1. Select one or multiple elements. Currently supporting: Frames, Auto-Layout Frames and Text.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. When a frame is selected, the plugin checks for an existing overlay named 'wip'. If found, it removes the overlay; if not, it creates a new rectangle with a red semi-transparent fill and positions it to cover the entire frame. When a text is selected plugin adds a red semi-transparent fill with the same logic.
  4. To delete the overlay or fill run the plugin again.


This plugin supports frames with Auto Layout, adjusting the overlay accordingly.


You can expect a straightforward way to highlight and manage WIP items in their Figma designs, with limitations around specific node type support.


Add the plugin to Keyboard Shortcuts:

  1. Settings -> Keyboard -> Keyboard Shortcuts... -> App Shortcuts
  2. Press [+] button and choose "Figma".
  3. Write the plugin name "wip!" in menu title. Add shortcut combination. I personally use control + option + w.
plugins.tagline: Show that the selected frames or copy are not yet ready and you're still working on them

plugins.name: Figma to JSON Exporter

Figma to JSON Exporter simplifies extracting design variables, styles, and components from your Figma file into a structured JSON format. With one click, copy design tokens (colors, typography, spacing, and more) for seamless integration into your development pipeline. This plugin saves time, ensures design consistency, and supports UI/UX designers, front-end developers, and teams managing design systems.


Designed & developed by Shakuro team: https://shakuro.com/

plugins.name: Bulk replace corner radius
plugins.description:
Quickly change corner radius in multiple elements, such as frames or components. You can update specific radius to another value, for example all 2px to 4px, all 4px to 8px, etc.


  1. Select elements
  2. Run plugin
  3. Bulk change your border radius - leave the field empty if you don't want to change some value
  4. Apply changes

plugins.name: Font Replacer - Compact
plugins.description:
üìù Description

Transform your text styles in seconds! The fastest way to batch update font styles in Figma with minimal effort.


‚ú® Key Features

- One-click batch replacement for multiple text layers

- Lightning-fast font style updates

- Real-time font preview with instant search

- Auto-detect and display mixed text styles

- Seamless dark mode support

- Clean, minimal interface for maximum efficiency


üöÄ Quick Start

1. Select text layers or frames

2. Pick your font settings

3. Click update - Done!


‚ö†Ô∏è Notes

- Ensure target fonts are installed in Figma

- Font names are case-sensitive

- Plugin automatically adapts to Figma's theme


üîß Troubleshooting

Common issues and quick fixes:

- Font not updating? ‚Üí Check if font is installed

- Text not changing? ‚Üí Ensure layers are unlocked

- Nothing selected? ‚Üí Select text layers first


If you have any suggestions, please feel free to let me know, thanks ‚ù§

Contact: kingyo@live.com
plugins.tagline: A super efficient Figma plugin for replacing text styles with minimal clicks.

plugins.name: Tiiny Color Palette Generator
plugins.description:
Tiiny empowers you to generate natural color palettes with tints and shades in 12 stops, based on your chosen base color.


Key Features:

  1. Dynamic Palette Generation: Automatically generate a cohesive color palette with multiple shades and tints tailored to your base color, ensuring visual consistency across your project.
  2. Customizable Formats: Choose between RGB, HSL, and HSB color formats to suit your specific design needs and preferences.
  3. Accessibility Focused: Designed with accessibility in mind, ensuring that your color choices are both visually appealing and inclusive.


Transform your design process with the Tiiny Color Palette Generator and bring vibrant, cohesive colors to your projects with just a few clicks. Elevate your creativity and ensure consistency across all your design endeavors!
plugins.tagline: Create natural looking color palettes with 12 stops, for your designs.

plugins.name: Hilbert
plugins.description:
Weave unique patterns with FASS curves.


FASS stands for 'space-Filling, self-Avoiding, Simple, and Self-similar curves' and they allow you to generate intricate patterns that are made with a single line. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space-filling_curve


How to use:


1) Select an object on your document and press "Pick".


->Your object will then be displayed as a clipping mask to help you preview the result.


2) Play.


3) Press "Place" to apply your artwork to the selected object.


-> The artwork will be clipped inside the object's geometry.


4) Select another object and press "Pick" to apply it as a the new clipping mask.


NOTE: For performance reasons this version is limited to a maximum of 5 iterations.


----------------------------------------------------------------

Want to support the development of free features and plugins?

You can buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Eduardo Barbosa
accepted.description: Creative Technologist. I build tools and systems that enhance quality of life, unlock new possibilities, and empower teams and individuals.

plugins.name: Framenizer - Organize frames with ease
plugins.description:
Framenizer is a Figma plugin designed to help you organize and manage your frames with ease. Whether you are working on a design system or a simple prototype, it streamlines your workflow by automatically organizing your frames.


Key features

  1. Automatic frame arrangement: Quickly organize your frames in either horizontal or vertical layouts with just a few clicks.
  2. Consistent spacing: Maintain a clean and professional look with consistent spacing between all your frames.
  3. Section titles: Add descriptive titles to your frame groups for better organization and documentation.
  4. Section wrapping: Group related frames together by wrapping them in dedicated sections.
  5. Naming options: Choose between preserving your original frame names or using automatic naming conventions.
  6. Support and feedback: Constantly improving the plugin based on your input.


Need help or have suggestions?

I am always looking to improve the plugin. If you have any questions, encounter issues, or have ideas for new features, please don't hesitate to reach out to me at achmadalimin.com or Linkedin.
plugins.tagline: Help you organize and manage your frames with ease.

plugins.name: Chameleon
plugins.description:
ü¶é CHAMELEON


Chameleon is a Figma plugin that turns color token management into a breeze. Build smart palettes, structure tokens, and export directly into native Figma Variables.



üé® KEY FEATURES


üé® Smart palette generation ‚Äî create harmonious color ramps from a single base color


üåí Auto dark theme ‚Äî instantly generate dark versions of your palettes


‚ôø A11Y mode ‚Äî contrast-optimized palettes that meet WCAG accessibility standards


üß∑ Figma Variables export ‚Äî full support for collections, modes, and cross-collection aliases


üì§ JSON import/export ‚Äî compatible with Figma Variables and Token Studio


‚úèÔ∏è Flexible structure ‚Äî rename shades, palettes, collections, and modes while preserving links



üåí AUTO DARK THEME


Instantly generate perceptually balanced dark palettes based on your light theme.


How it works:

  1. Inverts brightness scale: lightest shade (50) becomes darkest, darkest (900) becomes lightest
  2. Base color remains at position 500
  3. Brightness follows a perceptual (non-linear) scale
  4. Saturation is increased for dark shades, reduced for light ones
  5. Additional correction ensures visual harmony



üé® BASE MODE


Best for:

  1. Creating aesthetic palettes without strict contrast rules
  2. Branding and accent color systems
  3. Visually balanced UIs with emphasis on artistic control


Generation logic:

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50‚Äì400) and darker (600‚Äì900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



‚ôø A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ‚â• 1.3:1



üìå HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



‚öôÔ∏è UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light ‚Äî 95% ‚Üí 20%, Dark ‚Äî 15% ‚Üí 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (‚òÖ)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



üöß STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.
plugins.tagline: Color token generator with automatic shade scales and Figma Variables export

plugins.name: Stroke Manager
plugins.description:
Stroke Manager is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you efficiently manage stroke properties across multiple elements simultaneously. Perfect for designers who work with illustrations, icons, wireframes, or any vector content.


Key Features


  1. Batch Update Strokes: Modify stroke width, alignment, and end caps across multiple elements at once
  2. Smart Color Management: Map colors individually or override all strokes with a single color
  3. End Point Styling: Quickly apply different cap styles (round, square, arrow)
  4. Nested Elements: Apply changes to parent elements and all their children with a single click
  5. Color Detection: Intelligently groups similar colors to simplify your workflow


Why You'll Love It

Save valuable time by updating dozens or hundreds of stroke properties in seconds instead of tediously modifying each element individually. Stroke Manager is particularly useful when adapting illustrations for different sizes or contexts, ensuring consistent stroke weights and styles throughout your design.

Perfect for design system maintenance, icon libraries, and illustration collections, Stroke Manager helps you maintain visual consistency while dramatically speeding up your workflow.
plugins.tagline: Batch Update Strokes

plugins.name: Version Stack
plugins.description:
Version Stack allows you to create and manage multiple versions of selected frames in Figma with ease. Each version is automatically saved with a timestamp and arranged in a dedicated ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page using an auto-layout for seamless tracking. Forget manual duplication‚Äîthis plugin ensures that your design iterations are neatly organized and easily accessible.


How to Use:


1.Select a frame you want to save as a version.

2.Run the plugin, and click 'Save Version' . A new version with a timestamp will be saved in the ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page.

3.Each version is stacked vertically in an auto-layout, allowing you to track the evolution of your design effortlessly.


Important Note:

The frame name must remain the same for new versions to be added to the existing version stack.


Limitations:


‚Ä¢Works only with Frame nodes.

‚Ä¢Ensure the ‚ÄúVersion Stack‚Äù page is not renamed manually to avoid issues.


We Value Your Feedback:

We‚Äôre constantly looking to improve! If you have any suggestions, feedback, or feature requests, please share them with us. Your input will help make Version Stack even better for you and the design community. Thank you for using our plugin!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly save and manage design versions in an organized layout

plugins.name: figma-lokalise-unofficial-plugin
plugins.description:
Unofficial Lokalise Plugin.


Enhance Your Design Workflow with Our Figma Plugin for Lokalise


Our plugin bridges the gap between Figma and Lokalise, offering a seamless integration that streamlines your design localization process. With this tool at your disposal, you can:


Link Texts Between Figma and Lokalise: Easily connect text elements from your Figma designs with corresponding texts in Lokalise, ensuring consistency and accuracy across your project.


Update All Texts with One Click: Synchronize all your design texts with Lokalise in just one click. This feature ensures that all your text elements in Figma are up-to-date with the latest translations and content changes.


Switch Texts to Different Languages Instantly: Our plugin allows you to effortlessly change the language of text elements in your Figma designs. This capability is perfect for quickly adapting your designs to various language markets.


Set Individual Text Elements: Gain the flexibility to specify translations for each text element within Figma individually. This feature provides the precision needed for customizing specific parts of your design to suit different linguistic contexts.


Full demo here: https://youtu.be/VPveQklO4OE


Support me at Patreon ‚ù§Ô∏è

plugins.name: Mermaid-to-Flow
plugins.description:
Transform Mermaid markup into professional FigJam flowcharts with smart layouts, text wrapping, edge labels, and industry-standard color coding.


Features:

‚Ä¢ Smart hierarchical layouts with automatic positioning

‚Ä¢ Professional color coding (green start, red end, yellow decisions)

‚Ä¢ Edge labels for annotated workflows (A -->|"label"| B)

‚Ä¢ Shape-specific text wrapping for clean diagrams

‚Ä¢ Support for rectangles [text], diamonds {text}, and ellipses (text)

‚Ä¢ Both top-down (TD) and left-right (LR) layouts

‚Ä¢ No external dependencies - works entirely within FigJam


Perfect for business process documentation, software workflows, and technical diagrams. Simply paste your Mermaid code and generate publication-ready flowcharts instantly.
plugins.tagline: Convert Mermaid markup to FigJam flowcharts

137859.release_notes:
## [2.7.1] - 2025-06-15

### üêõ Critical Bug Fixes
- **Fixed standalone node parsing**: Now correctly parses both standalone node definitions and edge connections
  - **Issue**: Nodes were displaying IDs (Q, C, T) instead of text labels ("Pick a drink", "Coffee", "Tea")
  - **Root cause**: Parser only processed edge connections, ignored standalone node definitions
  - **Solution**: Enhanced parser to handle both `Q{Pick a drink}` definitions AND `Q --> C` connections
- **Complete syntax support**: All node types now correctly display text labels
  - `[Rectangle text]` ‚úÖ
  - `{Diamond text}` ‚úÖ 
  - `(Ellipse text)` ‚úÖ
  - `([Ellipse text])` ‚úÖ (both ellipse syntaxes supported)

### üîß Code Quality Improvements
- **Removed dead code**: Eliminated unused `_calculateLegacyLayout()` function (39 lines removed)
- **Optimized function signatures**: Removed unused `levels` parameter from `resolveNodeCollisions()`
- **Consolidated configuration**: Created unified `SHAPE_CONFIG` object for all node types
  - **Before**: Scattered across `getShapeTextConfig()`, `getNodeColors()`, `getShapeType()`
  - **After**: Single source of truth with `SHAPE_CONFIG` and `ROLE_COLORS` objects
- **Enhanced documentation**: Added comprehensive JSDoc comments for all public functions
- **Improved linting**: Created `.eslintignore` to exclude generated `code.js` file

### üß™ Testing & Validation
- **Extensive test coverage**: Verified with 5 diverse Mermaid test cases
  - Mixed node types with edge labels ‚úÖ
  - Left-right layouts with long text ‚úÖ
  - Complex branching decision trees ‚úÖ
  - Simple linear processes ‚úÖ
  - Multiple start/end points ‚úÖ
- **Version logging**: Added console logging to verify latest code is running
- **Clean builds**: All code compiles without errors and passes linting

### üìä Benefits
- ‚úÖ **Correct text display** - All node text labels now show properly instead of IDs
- ‚úÖ **Complete Mermaid support** - Both standalone definitions and edge syntax work perfectly
- ‚úÖ **Maintainable codebase** - Cleaner code with consolidated configuration and documentation
- ‚úÖ **Production ready** - Robust parsing handles real-world Mermaid syntax patterns
- ‚úÖ **Developer experience** - JSDoc documentation and clean code structure
137859.tagline: Convert Mermaid markup to FigJam flowcharts

plugins.name: Shopdev: Figma to Shopify Liquid
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify Liquid

Turn any Figma design into responsive Liquid code that‚Äôs ready to publish to your Shopify theme with the Shopdev Figma plugin. Select your frame in Figma, import it into Shopdev, and deploy in a few clicks, no coding required.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin: Launch the plugin directly within your Figma design file.
  2. Select the frame: Choose any frame, like a hero, banner, testimonial, or promo section.
  3. Click ‚ÄúImport frame‚Äù: The plugin automatically transfers your selected design to shopdev.ai.
  4. Customize prompt (Optional): You‚Äôll see a pre-filled prompt ‚ÄúBuild this Figma import‚Äù; you have the option to add extra input if desired (e.g., "Use a slider for the images on mobile").
  5. Submit the prompt: Shopdev will generate responsive Liquid code you can preview.
  6. Edit and iterate: Continue prompting shopdev to refine your design until it‚Äôs perfect.
  7. Publish: Click to deploy directly to your Shopify theme.


Support

For additional support using this plugin, ask questions in the Shopdev Discord channel.


Tips for best results: Use Auto Layout

Auto Layout isn‚Äôt required, but it helps the AI better understand your design‚Äôs structure and spacing. Using it can lead to more accurate imports with less additional prompting needed, especially for responsive layouts.


From Figma to Shopify with the help of Shopdev, an AI Shopify developer

With the Shopdev Figma plugin, you can convert any static Figma design into live, editable Shopify theme sections, ideal for:

  1. Homepage sections like banners, product features, testimonials, or value props
  2. Landing page sections that can be reused across multiple campaigns
  3. PDP add-ons like trust badges, comparison charts, or upsell modules
  4. Reusable content blocks that can be dragged and dropped across templates
  5. Custom sections for any part of your store without needing a developer


Shopdev automatically interprets your Figma design and generates responsive Liquid code that works natively within Shopify‚Äôs theme system. You can edit the output manually or continue refining it through prompts.
plugins.tagline: Use AI to turn any Figma design into Shopify-ready Liquid code
